item.title: Today’s Wordle #1582: Hints And Answer For October 18, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1582 for October 18, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There currently isn’t an app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 18, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1582 gives most players a challenge, much like many words over the last week. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.8 guesses out of 6 to get. That makes it tougher than October 17’s 4.2-guess average.

General Wordle Hints For October 18

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains two vowels.
  • Hint 2: It starts with H.
  • Hint 3: It often describes a safe or sheltered place.
  • Hint 4: Think sanctuary, refuge, or a harbor — that’s the word.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1582 for October 18, 2025

Starter Words For October 18, 2025

If you just want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • NAVEL
  • HONEY
  • VANES

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1582 On October 18, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: HAVEN

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1580 on October 16, 2025:

Answer: GROSS

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1582?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 19 will be Wordle Game #1583.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: When Is The Ninja Gaiden 4 Review Embargo Date?
item.content:encoded:
Ninja Gaiden 4 is a big deal for a lot of people. The franchise as a whole is one of the most iconic in the hack ‘n’ slash genre, and Ninja Gaiden is the first mainline game in 13 years—making the review embargo date a huge milestone for players itching to see what Ryu is up to this time.

We still have memories of being destroyed in 2004’s Ninja Gaiden growing up. As a youngster, that game was punishing, but it naturally increases your resolve and helps to reduce the tears experienced in later life via Souls games and other torturous franchises. But Ninja Gaiden’s carried a reputation for years for being ruthlessly difficult.

Ninja Gaiden 4 offers difficulty settings, making it something almost anyone can hop into. Be warned, though, the standard difficulty is relentless, so let’s see if the gameplay, systems, and design make it all worth it.

Ninja Gaiden 4 Review Embargo Date, Explained

According to multiple sources, the Ninja Gaiden 4 review embargo lifts on October 20, and it’s alleged that the embargo time is 4 PM PT.

Firstly, various outlets and content creators have indicated that the review embargo date is October 20. If you’re keeping up with Ninja Gaiden 4’s launch, you’ll know why this is so significant—it’s the day before the game’s official release date!

Game Informer has said to expect their review on October 20, and David Jagneaux of GamesBeat has also indicated an October 20 review embargo date. However, specific review time details have been outed by @GoodGameKofi.

The content creator said: “I completed Ninja GAIDEN 4 a couple of days ago. Currently cooking a video review dropping October 20th @ 7pm EST. Look out for it.”

Now, it could be the case that video reviews arrive later than written reviews, or this could be the universal review embargo time for written and video content. Take this information with a pinch of salt, just in case.

At the very least, we should expect Ninja Giaden 4 reviews to start flooding in on October 20.

Ninja Gaiden 4 Review Scores Prediction

We think a low-80s score is probably likely for Ninja Gaiden 4, based on previous NG titles and how it’s been received so far.

There feels like a million Ninja Gaiden games, from remakes to spin-offs. Let’s dissect recent Ninja Gaiden games via their Metacritic scores to see where we might stand.

Ninja Gaiden 3 was a disaster, scoring 58/100. Older Ninja Gaiden games were in the low-to-mid 90s, whereas recent entries like Ninja Gaiden 2 Black and Ragebound have comfortably been in the 80s. This is the first new mainline game in over a decade, and its reception at Gamescom has been positive. There have been some doubters and dissension, too, so we think an 82 or an 83 is a likely final score.

Hopefully, Ninja Gaiden 4 does former Team Ninja leader Tomonobu Itagaki proud.

What score do you think Ninja Gaiden 4 will get? Have you had a chance to play it? Tell us what you’ve made of its gameplay so far through the Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: New Dragon Ball Game Announcement Arrives in January 2026
item.content:encoded:
A new Dragon Ball game will be unveiled next year in January at the Genkida Matsuri event in Japan.

A lot of updates have been arriving recently in the Dragon Ball games space, with all the recent titles receiving some form of new DLC. We have already been informed that Sparking Zero’s devs have another DLC in the works for January 2026, and now it has been revealed that a new Dragon Ball game will be announced in the same window.

A New Dragon Ball Title to Look Forward to for the Franchise’s 40th Anniversary

The confirmation about the new Dragon Ball game project being announced in January 2026 comes from the official Dragon Ball Games account on X (formerly Twitter). At the Dragon Ball Genkida Matsuri event, all the latest content and major new announcements about Dragon Ball titles will be revealed. The voice of Son Goku, Masako Nozawa, will also be making an appearance at the event.

The Dragon Ball Genkida Matsuri event is scheduled for January 25, 2026. Admission to the event is free, but players must pre-register through this website.

We already have four ongoing Dragon Ball titles — Xenoverse 2, Kakarot, FighterZ, and Sparking Zero — each of which has received some form of Daima DLC recently and is actively receiving updates. Moreover, a free-to-play MOBA title, Dragon Ball Gekishin Squadra, is also being developed for iOS, Android, PS5, PS4, Nintendo Switch, and PC via Steam. Now, the new title that will be announced on Dragon Ball’s 40th Anniversary will be the sixth new title in recent years.

In other news, Sparking Zero’s Daima character Pack 2 is now available. What are your thoughts on a new Dragon Ball game being announced at the start of next year? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Marvel Rivals PvE Zombies Mode Arrives Next Week
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Rivals has a brand new surprise for the players, arriving in the form of the first-ever PvE Zombies mode on October 23, 2025.

Season 5 of Marvel Rivals is scheduled to arrive on November 14, bringing Gambit and Rogue into the mix. Ahead of that, the developers have one last new update for players in season 4.5, bringing some PvE fun into the mix. The upcoming game mode is inspired by the animated series Marvel Zombies.

Slay Zombies in Marvel Rivals From October 23

Through a new post on the official Marvel Rivals X account (formerly Twitter), the executive producer at Marvel Games, Danny Koo, spoke more about the upcoming PvE Zombies mode. The new Marvel Zombies-inspired mode lets players embody one of 5 playable characters —Thor, Blade, Magik, Jeff, or The Punisher —as they face off against endless hordes of zombies. Surviving is the goal until you can test your might against the two bosses, Zombie Namor and Queen of the Dead.

To take on this new threat, the developers have also granted each of the five heroes new abilities. Jeff can charge through the hordes, Blade can slice and dice through the bouncing Moon Blades, Thor gets a persistent Awakened State to shock more zombies, and Magik is getting an unlimited Darkchild form. The post also included a sneak peek of the Marvel Rivals PvE Zombies mode gameplay, featuring the 5-hero squad being ambushed by zombies from every angle, but still holding their ground.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Progression Issues and XP Leveling Will be Addressed Next Week
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 is receiving a new update within the next week, which will address progression pace and XP Leveling.

The launch of Battlefield 6 has shaken the gaming industry, with the new title rivalling the likes of Call of Duty launches. The game sold 7 million copies in the first 3 days, making it the biggest launch in series history. However, there have been some minor issues at launch, such as progression and XP leveling, and fortunately, the developers are already addressing them in the next update.

Battlefield 6 Devs Acknowledge Progression Pace Issues

In a lengthy new post on the BattlefieldComms account on X (formerly Twitter), the developers acknowledged the progression issues in Battlefield 6 and revealed how they will be addressing them. The developers understand that it’s taking way longer to unlock hardware, such as gadgets and weapon adjustments, and are making changes accordingly.

  • Match completely and daily bonuses, XP has been increased by 10% and 40% respectively.
  • The XP a players need to unlock the first 20 attachment ranks has been reduced, with useful attachments arriving twice as fast.
  • Players should note that the UI for weapons that are already being progressed might show something “abnormal at first”, but will be resolved once players use that weapon in a match.
  • The assignments that required career ranks 20, 23, and 26 to begin will now require career ranks 10, 15, and 20, respectively.
  • The developers are aware of the “frustrations regarding the challenges themselves and are actively working on reviewing them.” However, this change will take longer to develop, test, and implement.

The goal of Battlefield 6’s progression changes is to make the experience feel smoother and more rewarding while retaining the sense of achievement of fully mastering a weapon. The new update will go live within the next week or sooner, depending on testing and verification. The developers are also aware of concerns about visibility, weapon bloom, vehicles not spawning, and more, and will share more details when possible.

In other news, read about Battlefield Studios addressing the Portal ‘XP Farms‘ in the same patch. Additionally, a datamine has revealed that six more modes are coming to the game. item.title: Battlefield Studios Announce Battlefield 6 Portal ‘XP Farms’ Will Soon be Patched
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield Studios has announced that it will soon be making changes to the Battlefield 6 Portal to reduce the amount of ‘XP farms’ in the game that have been taking up server capacity.

In an announcement on the official Battlefield Communication channel, it was stated that since the launch of Battlefield 6, the maximum capacity of the Battlefield 6 Portal servers has been consistently reached, which has been attributed to XP farms.

They said, “After reviewing the data, we found that a large number of these servers were created primarily to earn XP, inflate player stats, and earn special accolades through defeating bots. We completely understand the motivation behind this, like faster progression and a way to test setups without pressure, but it’s led to some unintended side effects. With so many servers focused on farming XP rather than active play, it’s become noticeably harder for players to create and find experiences to play with other people.”

As such, changes will soon be coming to Battlefield Portal, including changes to “diminish the number of XP farms taking up server space while further emphasizing playing with friends on both custom and verified experiences.”

Battlefield 6 Portal Changes

It’s not entirely clear what the changes will be, but it’s likely to be an adjustment to the rate at which people earn XP in Battlefield Portal, meaning that they will be less likely to be used for XP farmers.

One change, though, could be the change that stats and accolades will no longer count towards your player stats, which has seen players artificially inflate their stats with absurd K/D ratios and more.

Presumably, however, the changes will be intended to incentivize people to transition to the core multiplayer experiences, as there will also be some progression updates to the game in this regard.

So for now, you should probably grind your weapons in Battlefield Portal before the changes coming in the coming days.
